subject: Re: [junit] How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... I value testing, so I generally do whatever it takes to make code testable. Not everyone values testing as much I do, especially compared to other
messageBody:
Maarten van wrote:
> Question: in how far should your production code be
> adapted to accomodate testing with JUnit?
>
> Should it be possible to use JUnit with All/Any form
> of Production Code?
>
> I myself currently frequently encounter the problem
> that 'oh, if only this method was not final', 'oh, if
> only this class did not have a 'default packagescope'
> constructor'', 'oh, if only this class was not
> declared final'.
>
> I tend to override all the methods that I do NOT wish
> to test and then let them do nothing, weed out stuff I
> do not want to test. But perhaps this is 'BAD' (tm)?

I value testing, so I generally do whatever it takes to make code
testable. Not everyone values testing as much I do, especially compared
to other considerations, so they do other things.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
